biography.bio: From the day she was born Martha lived in a world of music. For sure her father was a banker but he was also an amateur pianist. As for her mother, she was a housewife but also a very talented opera singer who had given up her career for the joys of matrimony and motherhood. It does not come as a surprise, under such circumstances, that the little girl's singing capacities were soon discovered. At eight she was already on a scene singing an aria from "The Barber of Seville". A critic attended the show and was impressed by her performance. He introduced her to the director of the Magyar Theater, where she landed her first contract. As of the age of 10 she was hailed as Hungary's "national idol". And it was not long before her triumph became international. An operetta, "Pogasza", was written specially for the crystal-clear-voiced little singer. Among others, she played the role of the doll in "Tales of Hoffmann" and starred in "Das Veilchen vom Montmartre" by Kalman. With the advent of sound films, she found herself very much in demand in the 1930s, bringing her beautiful voice and looks to yet more delighted viewers. It is on the set of "Mein Herz ruft nach dir" that she met Jan Kiepura, another successful opera and operetta singer. Although it was not love at first sight, Jan and Martha gradually fell in love, married two years later, had two sons and were separated only by death with the demise of Jan in 1966. In 1938, the couple fled Austria after its annexation by Hitler and settled down in the South of France first then in the USA. Martha made fewer movies but kept on singing. For instance she co-starred in "The merry Widow" in Broadway for three years with Jan Kiepura. She became an American citizen in the fifties and currently lives in Rye, new York.
biography.name: Mártha Eggerth

biography.bio: Sandro Palmieri is an actor, known for Casta diva (1935), Orpheus: The Day Before (1994) and The Magnificent Rogue (1935).
biography.name: Sandro Palmieri

biography.bio: Gualtiero Tumiati was born on May 8, 1876 in Ferrara, Italy. He was an actor, known for Eugenie Grandet (1946), The Little World of Don Camillo (1952) and Casta diva (1935). He was married to Beryl Hight. He died on April 23, 1971 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Gualtiero Tumiati

biography.bio: Lamberto Picasso was born on October 21, 1880 in La Spezia, Liguria, Italy. He was an actor, known for Les frères Karamazov (1947), La dame de tout le monde (1934) and Heart and Soul (1948). He died on September 17, 1962 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Lamberto Picasso

biography.bio: Achille Majeroni was born on August 24, 1881 in Siracusa, Sicily, Italy. He is known for his work on I Vitelloni (1953), The Ape Woman (1964) and The Conjugal Bed (1963). He was married to Ersilia Arrighi and Lea Müller. He died on October 12, 1964 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Achille Majeroni

biography.placeOfBirth: Santa Maria Capua Vetere, Campania, Italy
biography.bio: Giulio Donadio was born on July 5, 1889 in Santa Maria Capua Vetere, Campania, Italy. He was an actor and director, known for L'ispettore Vargas (1940), Passaporto rosso (1935) and La cicala (1919). He died on June 15, 1951 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Giulio Donadio

biography.bio: After working in the theater for many years, he made his debut in the cinema in 1932 with "L'armata azzurra", one of the first Italian sound film, directed by Gennaro Rulers, and later by "Il dottor Antonio" (1937) and "Ho visto brillare le stelle" (1939) both by Enrico Guazzoni and "Fanfulla da Lodi" by Giulio Antamoro and Carlo Duse (1940); later he played many other films, but in parts of the second floor. In 1936 he married the actress and work-mate Emma Baron, with which will set up several companies to tour both in Italy and in the United States.
biography.name: Ennio Cerlesi

biography.bio: Vasco Creti was born on December 7, 1874 in Florence, Tuscany, Italy. He was an actor, known for Company and the Crazy (1928), Sole! (1929) and La leggenda di Pierrette (1916). He died on October 16, 1945 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Vasco Creti

biography.bio: Oreste Bilancia was born on September 24, 1881 in Catania, Sicily, Italy. He was an actor, known for Il controllore dei vagoni letto (1922), La tentation (1928) and Four Steps in the Clouds (1942). He was married to Asta Gundt. He died on October 31, 1945 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Oreste Bilancia

biography.bio: Albino Principe was born on November 16, 1920 in Naples, Italy. He was an actor and writer, known for Un giorno, una vita (1970), The Roar of the Bolidi (1961) and La colpa di una madre (1952). He died on April 27, 1980 in Rome, Lazio, Italy.
biography.name: Albino Principe

biography.bio: Diana Lante was born in 1914 in Modena, Emilia-Romagna, Italy as Diana Lante Della Rovere. She is an actress, known for L'albergo della felicità (1936), The Wedding March (1936) and Il destino in tasca (1938).
biography.name: Diana Lante

biography.bio: Bruna Dragoni is an actress, known for La serva padrona (1934), Casta diva (1935) and I due barbieri (1937).
biography.name: Bruna Dragoni

biography.bio: Maurizio D'Ancora was only seventeen when he was spotted by Danish director Alfred Lind who gave him a supporting role in Ragazze non scherzate (1929). But it was with his second movie Rails (1929), directed by Mario Camerini, that success came. Thanks to his good looks, his penetrating eyes and his regular guy airs, he soon imposed himself both on the public and on the critics in movies of fairly good quality (Casta diva (1935) being one of these) and remained very much in demand until the mid-forties. In 1944 he married actress Sandra Ravel, had a son named Maurizio like him, but was unfortunately widowed ten years later. In 1946 Maurizio D'Ancora (whose real name is Rodolfo Gucci) decided to give up acting to join his brothers and devote himself to the famous fashion house Gucci.
biography.name: Maurizio D'Ancora

biography.bio: Cesare Bettarini was born on October 17, 1901 in Calenzano, Tuscany, Italy. He was an actor, known for La damigella di Bard (1938), The Wedding March (1936) and Fascino (1939). He died on October 19, 1975 in Calenzano.
biography.name: Cesare Bettarini

biography.bio: Alfredo Robert was born on April 5, 1877 in Fucecchio, Tuscany, Italy. He is a director and actor, known for The Evil's Way (1912), Il re della maschera d'oro (1920) and Le spectre blanc (1914).
biography.name: Alfredo Robert
